data.actual_result: The iOS spellchecker can "correct" the emote code and replace it by some words that it will find "correct".
data.expected_result: Once the person clicked on an emote suggestion, the correct emote code is typed in the text bar.
data.short_description: iOS spellchecker autocorrects emotes if the emote preview is chosen instead of typing entirely the emote.
data.steps_to_repro: - Use a spellchecker that will detect emotes as a mistake (the best is to not use English, I used French personally) - Type the first part of an emote - Click on a suggestion of the emote preview - Observe the correction done by the spellchecker - If you use too many times the emote, the spellchecker will learn it and will not "correct" it
